summary: This document is an email chain from July 24-25, 2019, reporting that Jeffrey Epstein was found in his cell at MCC New York with a noose around his neck and placed on suicide watch. It also mentions Epstein reported his cellmate had previously threatened to kill him.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Found in his cell at MCC New York with a noose around his neck and placed on suicide watch; reported his cellmate had threatened him.

persons.name: TAmaladas
persons.context: Sent the initial report from the Bureau of Prisons about the incident involving Jeffrey Epstein.

connections.description: TAmaladas, a Supervisory Deputy US Marshal, reported on the incident involving Epstein in custody.

events.title: Epstein Found with Noose in Cell
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found in his cell at MCC New York at 0127 hours in a fetal position with a noose around his neck, escorted to medical, and placed on suicide watch.

events.title: Epstein Reports Cellmate Threat
events.description: Epstein reported that his cellmate had previously threatened to kill him.

locations: MCC New York (Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York)
keyFacts: On July 24, 2019, Jeffrey Epstein was found in his cell at MCC New York at 0127 hours with a noose around his neck.
Epstein was placed on suicide watch and later downgraded to suicide observation.
Epstein reported that his cellmate had previously threatened to kill him.
The incident was under investigation by the Bureau of Prisons (BOP).
The email chain includes a correction clarifying that Epstein reported the threat, not that the cellmate reported being threatened.
